user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_softirq_dispatch:
```c
void metal_softirq_dispatch(void)
{
	int i;

	for (i = 0; i < metal_softirq_num; i++) {
		struct metal_irq *irq;
		char is_pending = 1;

		if (atomic_load(&metal_softirq_enabled[i]) != 0 &&
		    atomic_compare_exchange_strong(&metal_softirq_pending[i],
						   &is_pending, 0)) {
			irq = &metal_softirqs[i];
			(void)metal_irq_handle(irq,
					       i + metal_softirq_cntr.irq_base);
		}
	}
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_softirq_dispatch:

...

...

...

...
static METAL_IRQ_CONTROLLER_DECLARE(metal_softirq_cntr,
				    METAL_IRQ_ANY, METAL_SOFTIRQ_NUM,
				    NULL,
				    metal_softirq_set_enable, NULL,
				    metal_softirqs)
...
struct metal_irq {
	metal_irq_handler hd; /**< Interrupt handler */
	void *arg; /**< Argument to pass to the interrupt handler */
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The only potential unreachable code in this function resides in the loop and its conditional body: whether the loop executes at all depends on the runtime value of metal_softirq_num, and whether the conditional body executes depends on runtime values of the atomic flags. There are no other branches, switch/case labels, or statements in the function that could be statically determined as unreachable. Declarations outside this loop (the function signature, local variable declarations, and the referenced METAL_IRQ_CONTROLLER_DECLARE and struct metal_irq definitions) are not themselves unreachable code — they are definitions or declarations required at compile/link time and do not constitute unreachable executable statements. Likewise, individual statements inside the loop that are guarded by the shown condition are already included in the selected fragment for investigation; no other separate code fragments in the provided code appear to be (statically) unreachable.
